intro: Cuphea calcarata var. dichostemon, commonly known as the spurred cuphea, is a species native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its distinctive spurred flowers, which are typically pink to red in color. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Its unique floral structure and vibrant colors make it an attractive ornamental plant.
